source_files_expected: notebooklm-podcast-auto/personlighedspsykologi/sources/W10L1 Køn/W10L1 Bjerrum Nielsen, H. & Rudberg, M. (2006). Ytre og indre kjønn i forandring. I Moderne jenter. 117-149. Oslo.pdf
source_files_covered: notebooklm-podcast-auto/personlighedspsykologi/sources/W10L1 Køn/W10L1 Bjerrum Nielsen, H. & Rudberg, M. (2006). Ytre og indre kjønn i forandring. I Moderne jenter. 117-149. Oslo.pdf

summary_lines: Teksten analyserer køn som en psykosocial proces, der formes i samspillet mellem intime erfaringer og sociale institutioner.
Feminitet og maskulinitet fremstilles som noget, der forhandles gennem livsforløb og historiske skift, ikke som faste træk.
Analysen kobler identitetsudvikling til ændringer i familie, uddannelse og offentlig kultur.
The chapter analyzes transformations in gender identity by distinguishing outer social positioning from inner lived experience.
key_points: Kønnet subjektivitet dannes i mødet mellem indre liv og sociale forventninger.
Udviklingsbaner varierer på tværs af generation og klasse.
Normer for femininitet og maskulinitet er historisk foranderlige.
Identitetsarbejde rummer konflikt, ambivalens og løbende omfortolkning.
Outer and inner gender dimensions may diverge and be reworked across development.

source_files_expected: notebooklm-podcast-auto/personlighedspsykologi/sources/W10L2 Sociokulturelle teorier - socialkonstruktionisme og poststrukturalisme/W10L2 Foucault, M. (1997). The Ethics of the Concern of the Self as a Practice of Freedom - Essential Works 1954-1984, Penguin Books. Vol. 1, s. 281-301.pdf
notebooklm-podcast-auto/personlighedspsykologi/sources/W10L2 Sociokulturelle teorier - socialkonstruktionisme og poststrukturalisme/W10L2 X Davies (1990).pdf

The Ethics of the Concern of the Self as a Practice of Freedom - Essential Works 1954-1984, Penguin Books. Vol. 1, s. 281-301.pdf
notebooklm-podcast-auto/personlighedspsykologi/sources/W10L2 Sociokulturelle teorier - socialkonstruktionisme og poststrukturalisme/W10L2 X Davies (1990).pdf

summary_lines: Foucault reframes ethics as a practice of freedom rooted in the active care of the self.
Rather than universal moral law, he emphasizes historically situated practices through which subjects constitute themselves.
The interview links truth, power, and subjectivation to everyday ethical work on conduct.
Davies develops a feminist poststructural account of the subject as discursively produced and positioned.
key_points: Subjectivity is formed through practices, not simply discovered as an inner essence.
Care of the self is relational and political, not merely individual self-help.
Freedom is exercised within power relations through reflective transformation.
Ethics concerns style of life and practices of self-government.
Subjects are constituted through discourse rather than pre-social interiors.

source_files_expected: notebooklm-podcast-auto/personlighedspsykologi/sources/W11L1 Poststrukturalisme, diskursiv psykologi og feministisk teori/W11L1 Gergen (1999).pdf
notebooklm-podcast-auto/personlighedspsykologi/sources/W11L1 Poststrukturalisme, diskursiv psykologi og feministisk teori/W11L1 Grundbog kapitel 11 - Postpsykologisk subjektiveringsteori.pdf
notebooklm-podcast-auto/personlighedspsykologi/sources/W11L1 Poststrukturalisme, diskursiv psykologi og feministisk teori/W11L1 Hacking (2007).pdf
source_files_covered: notebooklm-podcast-auto/personlighedspsykologi/sources/W11L1 Poststrukturalisme, diskursiv psykologi og feministisk teori/W11L1 Gergen (1999).pdf
notebooklm-podcast-auto/personlighedspsykologi/sources/W11L1 Poststrukturalisme, diskursiv psykologi og feministisk teori/W11L1 Grundbog kapitel 11 - Postpsykologisk subjektiveringsteori.pdf
notebooklm-podcast-auto/personlighedspsykologi/sources/W11L1 Poststrukturalisme, diskursiv psykologi og feministisk teori/W11L1 Hacking (2007).pdf

summary_lines: Gergen presents a social constructionist view in which psychological realities are generated in relational processes.
He challenges individualist models by emphasizing language, culture, and coordinated action.
The text argues that personhood is historically variable and pragmatically sustained in social life.
Kapitlet omformulerer personlighed som løbende subjektivering frem for en fast indre kerne.
key_points: Knowledge claims are shaped by communal practices and discourse.
The self is relationally constituted rather than self-contained.
Psychological categories are culturally contingent and revisable.
Theory should track practices that create shared realities.
Subjektpositioner er historisk og politisk organiserede.

source_files_expected: notebooklm-podcast-auto/personlighedspsykologi/sources/W11L2 Narrativitet, kultur og mening/W11L2 Bank, M. (2014). Narrative psykologier. I Køppe, S. & Dammeyer, J. (Red.).pdf
notebooklm-podcast-auto/personlighedspsykologi/sources/W11L2 Narrativitet, kultur og mening/W11L2 Grundbog kapitel 9 - Narrative teorier.pdf

source_files_covered: notebooklm-podcast-auto/personlighedspsykologi/sources/W11L2 Narrativitet, kultur og mening/W11L2 Bank, M. (2014). Narrative psykologier. I Køppe, S. & Dammeyer, J. (Red.).pdf
notebooklm-podcast-auto/personlighedspsykologi/sources/W11L2 Narrativitet, kultur og mening/W11L2 Grundbog kapitel 9 - Narrative teorier.pdf

notebooklm-podcast-auto/personlighedspsykologi/sources/W11L2 Narrativitet, kultur og mening/W11L2 X Raggatt (2002).pdf

summary_lines: Bank introducerer narrative psykologier, hvor personen forstås gennem fortælling, tid og meningsdannelse.
Kapitlet kontrasterer narrative perspektiver med træk- og mekanismeorienterede personlighedsmodeller.
Identitet fremstilles som noget, der skabes i kulturelt medierede fortællepraksisser.
Bruner argues that human meaning is fundamentally narrative and culturally organized.
key_points: Narrativer organiserer hukommelse, motiver og oplevet kontinuitet.
Livsfortællinger samskabes i sociale og kulturelle sammenhænge.
Analysen retter sig mod plot, stemme og positionering.
Psykologisk forandring kan beskrives som narrativ revision over tid.
Meaning-making depends on culturally shared narrative forms.

notebooklm-podcast-auto/personlighedspsykologi/sources/W12L1 Sammenligning af teorier og subjektets historie og eksamen/W12L1 Grundbog kapitel 14 - Perspektiver på personlighedspsykologi.pdf
notebooklm-podcast-auto/personlighedspsykologi/sources/W12L1 Sammenligning af teorier og subjektets historie og eksamen/W12L1 Grundbog kapitel 8 - Personlighed, subjektivitet og historicitet.pdf

notebooklm-podcast-auto/personlighedspsykologi/sources/W12L1 Sammenligning af teorier og subjektets historie og eksamen/W12L1 Grundbog kapitel 8 - Personlighed, subjektivitet og historicitet.pdf

summary_lines: Elias links personality formation to long-term civilizing processes and changing social interdependencies.
He argues that self-regulation develops historically with transformations in power, institutions, and everyday manners.
The text situates psychological development within macro-sociological change.
Kapitlet sammenligner centrale personlighedsteorier og vurderer deres styrker og begrænsninger.
key_points: Subjective self-control is historically produced, not timeless.
Interdependence chains shape emotional standards and conduct.
Personality development is tied to social figurations.
Sociogenesis and psychogenesis must be analyzed together.
Intet enkelt paradigme kan forklare alle personlighedsfænomener.

source_files_expected: notebooklm-podcast-auto/personlighedspsykologi/sources/W1L1 Introforelæsning og nøglebegreber i personlighedspsykologien/W1L1 Grundbog kapitel 1 - Introduktion til personlighedspsykologi.pdf
notebooklm-podcast-auto/personlighedspsykologi/sources/W1L1 Introforelæsning og nøglebegreber i personlighedspsykologien/W1L1 Lewis (1999).pdf
source_files_covered: notebooklm-podcast-auto/personlighedspsykologi/sources/W1L1 Introforelæsning og nøglebegreber i personlighedspsykologien/W1L1 Grundbog kapitel 1 - Introduktion til personlighedspsykologi.pdf
notebooklm-podcast-auto/personlighedspsykologi/sources/W1L1 Introforelæsning og nøglebegreber i personlighedspsykologien/W1L1 Lewis (1999).pdf

summary_lines: Introduktionskapitlet kortlægger centrale spørgsmål, begreber og stridspunkter i personlighedspsykologi.
Det sammenholder hovedtraditioner og viser, hvordan antagelser former metoder og resultater.
Personlighed fremstilles både som mønstret kontinuitet og kontekstfølsom forandring.
Lewis examines the development of self-conscious emotions and their role in personality organization.
key_points: Definitioner af personlighed bestemmer, hvad der tæller som evidens.
Forskellige paradigmer prioriterer forskellige forklaringsniveauer.
Kontinuitet og forandring er begge grundproblemer i forskningen.
Teorivalg har både praktiske og etiske konsekvenser.
Self-conscious emotions require reflexive awareness of self.

summary_lines: This article addresses contemporary challenges in personality assessment and construct interpretation.
It examines how measurement choices affect validity, comparability, and theoretical conclusions.
The argument stresses tighter alignment between assessment design and inferential goals.
Mayer and Bryan discuss frameworks for evaluating personality assessment quality and scope.
key_points: Assessment is theory-laden and not method-neutral.
Construct validity depends on clear conceptual operationalization.
Different instruments can imply different models of personhood.
Transparent inference criteria improve interpretability.
Assessment quality includes conceptual as well as statistical adequacy.

source_files_expected: notebooklm-podcast-auto/personlighedspsykologi/sources/W2L1 Personality traits, personality states, and personality dimensions/W2L1 Columbus & Strandsbjerg (2025).pdf
notebooklm-podcast-auto/personlighedspsykologi/sources/W2L1 Personality traits, personality states, and personality dimensions/W2L1 X Zettler et al. (2020).pdf
source_files_covered: notebooklm-podcast-auto/personlighedspsykologi/sources/W2L1 Personality traits, personality states, and personality dimensions/W2L1 Columbus & Strandsbjerg (2025).pdf
notebooklm-podcast-auto/personlighedspsykologi/sources/W2L1 Personality traits, personality states, and personality dimensions/W2L1 X Zettler et al. (2020).pdf

summary_lines: This text examines distinctions and relations between personality traits, states, and broader dimensions.
It clarifies temporal stability assumptions and context sensitivity in trait-state modeling.
The authors argue for integrative measurement strategies that capture both enduring and situational variability.
The article evaluates trait structure and explanatory models in contemporary differential psychology.
key_points: Traits and states should be modeled as connected, not opposed.
Temporal scale matters for interpreting stability.
Context can systematically shape state expression.
Dimensional models require explicit level-of-analysis choices.
Trait models depend on assumptions about covariance structure.

source_files_expected: notebooklm-podcast-auto/personlighedspsykologi/sources/W2L2 Person-situation interplay - stability and change of individual differences/W2L2 Bleidorn et al. (2022).pdf
notebooklm-podcast-auto/personlighedspsykologi/sources/W2L2 Person-situation interplay - stability and change of individual differences/W2L2 Li & Wilt (2025).pdf
source_files_covered: notebooklm-podcast-auto/personlighedspsykologi/sources/W2L2 Person-situation interplay - stability and change of individual differences/W2L2 Bleidorn et al. (2022).pdf
notebooklm-podcast-auto/personlighedspsykologi/sources/W2L2 Person-situation interplay - stability and change of individual differences/W2L2 Li & Wilt (2025).pdf

summary_lines: This meta-analysis synthesizes longitudinal evidence on personality stability and mean-level change across the lifespan.
It confirms substantial rank-order stability while documenting systematic maturation-linked change patterns.
Findings refine earlier estimates and highlight developmental periods with stronger change dynamics.
Li and Wilt analyze person-situation interplay in the expression and development of individual differences.
key_points: Rank-order stability increases into adulthood and then plateaus.
Mean-level change tends toward greater maturity on several traits.
Effect sizes vary by trait breadth and measurement level.
Large-scale longitudinal synthesis improves precision of lifespan claims.
Behavior emerges from trait-situation coupling rather than either alone.

source_files_expected: notebooklm-podcast-auto/personlighedspsykologi/sources/W3L1 Culture, evolution, genetics, and personality/W3L1 Kandler & Instinske (2025).pdf
notebooklm-podcast-auto/personlighedspsykologi/sources/W3L1 Culture, evolution, genetics, and personality/W3L1 Lu, Benet-Martínez & Wang (2023).pdf

notebooklm-podcast-auto/personlighedspsykologi/sources/W3L1 Culture, evolution, genetics, and personality/W3L1 Zettler et al. (2025).pdf

notebooklm-podcast-auto/personlighedspsykologi/sources/W3L1 Culture, evolution, genetics, and personality/W3L1 Lu, Benet-Martínez & Wang (2023).pdf
notebooklm-podcast-auto/personlighedspsykologi/sources/W3L1 Culture, evolution, genetics, and personality/W3L1 Volk & Puchalski (2025).pdf
notebooklm-podcast-auto/personlighedspsykologi/sources/W3L1 Culture, evolution, genetics, and personality/W3L1 Zettler et al. (2025).pdf

summary_lines: This review synthesizes evidence that personality differences are shaped by many small genetic and environmental influences rather than single dominant causes.
It emphasizes that broad trait scores can hide specific mechanisms and that measurement strategy strongly affects what effects are detected.
The authors call for multimodal, multi-perspective designs that model gene-environment interplay more directly.
This article investigates how culture shapes personality structure, expression, and adaptation.
key_points: Personality architecture appears polygenic and poly-environmental.
Single-factor explanations have weak explanatory power for trait variance.
Operationalization choices influence observed genetic and environmental effects.
Future research should target interaction effects and person-specific pathways.
Cultural context conditions trait expression and interpretation.

summary_lines: Udvalget samler centrale freudianske formuleringer om psykisk konflikt, symptomdannelse og personlighedsstruktur.
En dynamisk model udvikles, hvor ubevidste processer præger bevidst oplevelse og handling.
Teksten forbinder metapsykologiske begreber med klinisk tolkning af kompromisdannelser.
This English selection outlines foundational Freudian claims about drives, conflict, and psychic organization.
key_points: Ubevidst konflikt organiserer symptomers form og mening.
Psykens instanser forstås gennem funktionelle spændinger.
Tolkning søger forbindelsen mellem manifeste fænomener og latente processer.
Kliniske observationer og teoriudvikling belyser hinanden gensidigt.
Psychic life is structured by conflict and compromise.

source_files_expected: notebooklm-podcast-auto/personlighedspsykologi/sources/W4L2 Psykoanalytisk personlighedsstruktur/W4L2 Laplanche, J. (1970). Liv og død i psykoanalysen (pp. 18‐38).pdf
source_files_covered: notebooklm-podcast-auto/personlighedspsykologi/sources/W4L2 Psykoanalytisk personlighedsstruktur/W4L2 Laplanche, J. (1970). Liv og død i psykoanalysen (pp. 18‐38).pdf

summary_lines: Lacan analyzes subjectivity through language, symbolic structure, and desire.
The text challenges ego-centered models by emphasizing the split subject and structural determination.
Personality organization is treated as effects of symbolic positioning and identification.
Laplanche proposes a historical-structural reading of Freud that treats conceptual contradictions as theoretically productive.
key_points: The subject is constituted in and by language.
Ego coherence can mask deeper symbolic divisions.
Desire is mediated through signification and the Other.
Structural reading reframes symptoms as signifying formations.
Contradictions are analytic resources, not merely errors.

summary_lines: Kapitlet udvikler en fænomenologisk tilgang til personlighed med udgangspunkt i levet erfaring og mening.
Analysen flyttes fra abstrakte træk til person-verdensrelationer, krop og intentionalitet.
Personlighed forstås som en situeret organisering af erfaring på tværs af konkrete livssammenhænge.
This text applies phenomenological analysis to contemporary questions of selfhood and psychological understanding.
key_points: Førstepersonsperspektivet er en central kilde til psykologisk viden.
Mening dannes relationelt i personens engagement i verden.
Metoden prioriterer deskriptiv og fortolkende stringens frem for reduktionisme.
Handlekraft og sårbarhed analyseres som samtidige vilkår.
Experience is structured and analyzable without reducing it to variables alone.

summary_lines: Boss develops Daseinsanalytic perspectives that reinterpret psychopathology through modes of being-in-the-world.
He critiques mechanistic explanatory models and emphasizes existential openness and restriction.
Personality understanding is grounded in how existence is disclosed in concrete situations.
May articulates existential psychology around anxiety, freedom, responsibility, and meaning.
key_points: Psychological suffering can be read as constricted possibilities of being.
Existential analysis prioritizes world-relation over intrapsychic mechanics alone.
Clinical interpretation tracks lived structure rather than symptom counting.
Ontology and therapy are methodologically connected.
Anxiety is a structural feature of freedom, not merely pathology.

summary_lines: Cooper presents existential therapeutic perspectives focused on lived choice, meaning, and relational presence.
The text integrates phenomenological description with clinical practice principles.
It emphasizes collaborative inquiry into how persons inhabit possibilities and constraints.
Jacobsen diskuterer eksistentielle og fænomenologiske bidrag til moderne personligheds- og klinisk psykologi.
key_points: Therapy is an encounter oriented to meaning clarification.
Existential concerns organize many presenting problems.
Client agency is foregrounded within contextual limits.
Method favors dialogical exploration over prescriptive technique.
Eksistentiel analyse supplerer træk- og symptomorienterede modeller.

summary_lines: This text engages humanistic psychology through person-centered themes such as growth, authenticity, and relationship.
It critiques restrictive models of the person and argues for experiential depth in psychological theory.
Human development is framed as unfolding potential under supportive relational conditions.
Giorgi argues that humanistic psychology was a necessary correction to reductionist behaviorist and orthodox psychoanalytic models.
key_points: Person-centered perspectives prioritize lived experience and agency.
Relational climate strongly influences development trajectories.
Humanistic models challenge deficit-focused frameworks.
Growth is understood as contextually enabled, not automatic.
Humanistic psychology restored the person as a central unit of analysis.

summary_lines: Lamiell advances a critical personalist perspective that questions reified trait entities and abstracted population claims.
He emphasizes persons as concrete, historically situated agents rather than variable bundles.
The argument calls for epistemic caution about what personality measures can legitimately represent.
Laux and colleagues discuss critical personalism as a framework for integrating person, action, and context.
key_points: Person-level reality cannot be reduced to abstract trait scores.
Methodological individualism requires conceptual, not only statistical, rigor.
Population regularities do not automatically explain singular persons.
Critical personalism re-centers agency and context in personality theory.
Action is a key unit for linking person and environment.

summary_lines: Holzkamp udvikler et grundlag for kritisk psykologi ved at sætte subjektivitet, samfundsmæssige vilkår og handlemuligheder i centrum.
Han kritiserer individualiserende forklaringer, som løsriver problemer fra menneskers levede sociale relationer.
Psykologisk analyse omorienteres mod betingelser for handlekraft og frigørelse.
Tolman reviews key commitments of critical psychology and its implications for theory and method.
key_points: Subjektivitet er socialt medieret og historisk formet.
Analysen retter sig mod handlebegrænsninger og handlemuligheder i kontekst.
Psykologi bør undgå at reducere strukturelle modsætninger til private mangler.
Kritisk teori og empirisk arbejde skal informere hinanden gensidigt.
Standpoint and context are constitutive for psychological explanation.

source_files_expected: notebooklm-podcast-auto/personlighedspsykologi/sources/W9L1 Kritisk psykologi/W9L1 Grundbog kapitel 10 - Kritisk psykologi.pdf
source_files_covered: notebooklm-podcast-auto/personlighedspsykologi/sources/W9L1 Kritisk psykologi/W9L1 Grundbog kapitel 10 - Kritisk psykologi.pdf

summary_lines: Dreier analyzes persons through trajectories of participation across social practices.
He argues that psychological phenomena are distributed across contexts rather than localized inside individuals.
The text develops a practice-based account of subjectivity, learning, and change.
Kapitlet introducerer kritisk psykologi som en ramme, der forbinder personlighed med samfundsmæssige betingelser og magt.
key_points: Persons move through multiple practice contexts with shifting positions.
Meaning and competence are co-produced in participation.
Analysis must follow cross-context movement over time.
Subjectivity is organized through practical social relations.
Subjektivitet er socialt produceret og historisk foranderlig.
